column2: an A.M. Eatery////a possible reason that just dawned on me
column3: might be that servers tend to take more breaks and be less attentive when there are fewer customers.  on the other hand
column4: with fewer tickets the cooks can turn almost any order out in under 5 minutes.  the irony is that since the social distancing and reduced capacity requirements have been imposed
column5: the restaurant isn't as busy and this is encourages servers (who are used to the cooks taking over 15 minutes per order under normal busy conditions) to go on break/smoke/etc ... while my food goes stale on the counter.
